intro: Lotoxalis fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered lotox, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a hairy texture. Lotoxalis fasciculata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
